ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Critical reading and writing about poetry, understanding of formal components of poetry, historical context surrounding the work of notable poets, knowledge of the movements in English poetry.

Helped my writing and close reading a TON! Joe was incredible, and I learned how to close read by studying amazing poetry! Really great essay feedback as well that has helped me learn how to craft a strong argument. Also has made me appreciate poetry and word choice, by reading some of the people who have done it the best.
I learned to deepen my appreciation for poetry and close reading!  There's so much more to a poem than what might meet your eye--this class teaches you to observe closely and carefully.
I really learned how to analyze poetry very deeply.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think that we had an excellent depth of engagement with certain poets, but, constrained by time, we were unable to engage with as broad a range of poets. We were able to dive into certain poets, especially Dickinson in great detail, but I would still appreciate reading other poets of the time to contextualize her work.

Great class in poetry - especially with Joe! He picks great poems/poets to engage with and is so knowledgable about their nuances that discussion was very rich. Take this as one of your foundational requirements for the major! Or even if your not in the major, you will learn how to close read and articulate in your writing!

This class was a great way to hone my close reading and analytical skills!  I read so many great poems that touched me, learned to experience art more deeply, and strengthened my ability to express my thoughts.
Well designed, covers interesting material, could be improved by better feedback
Would've been nice to cover more poets as opposed to just a handful
I wish that we had possibly read a few more poets over the semester.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I this course was a welcome introduction to critical and formal approaches to interpreting poetry for me.

YES TAKE IT WITH JOE!!! He picked great poets to dive deep into understanding the nuances of word choice and poetic layers of interpretation. Take it as a foundational english requirement or even if you are outside of the major - your close reading and writing will become so much better!

Yes!  This class was an amazing way to engage with authors I had only heard of but never had the chance to read, like Dickinson and Dylan Thomas.  Reading their poems has changed my life, and I'm so grateful I was able to break them apart in the company of my peers and professor.
yes! definitely take anything with Prof. North
Sure, as an English major requirement, but if you're just looking to take a cool English course for fun, there are better ones out there.
Yes! I really enjoyed the course!
